Text:
Mundane Mann—the secret identity being used by Cid
to participate in the Bushin Festival.

After winning the preliminary for block B and
securing his place in the main competition,
he walks through town when a shadowy
figure suddenly calls out to him—
Seems like you're on a roll, huh?
What do you want?

Calm down now, I ain't gonna do nothin' shady.
I'm just a gambling man.
I'm...yeah, you can call me Bookie.
And...? What do you want?

Everyone's sayin' that your win was just luck, but
I know that ain't it. I know who you really are.
(I already know how this is gonna go...)

(It's the "looks like a normal background character,
but there are those who sense his greatness" trope!)

(But he said my "true identity", not my "true power".
It's probably a good idea to try and get him to tell
me what he thinks he knows.)
Who I...really am?
Yeah. You and your group are cheatin' the system!
Cheating...? Heh, is that what you think?

(It doesn't seem like he's figured out my
real power.)

(It's a bit of a letdown, but... I kinda like where
this is going, so I'll roll with it.)

Heh, you can play dumb all you want, but you ain't
foolin' me!

In this business, we always take a real good look at
the participants' power balance. Otherwise, we
might take a loss.

It's cutthroat. Not to brag, but for people like me
who're makin' money, there's always someone
tryin' to fix the matches so I lose.

First Goldy, then Quinton... Considerin' the odds
against you, I wager you paid them pretty
handsomly to lose, huh?

But they ain't really losers. They prob'ly made back
the money they spent to enter, and then some.
Right...

So you think I'm playing dirty because going up
against strong opponents doesn't faze me.
Glad we're on the same page.
And that my fights until now have all been fixed.

But my next opponent is Annerose Nichtsehen. She seems
pretty straight-laced, and even if I did pay try and pay
her off, who knows if she'd accept.
That's why you picked this timing...am I right?

You got it. You made some good money up
'till now, right?

I'll let you off the hook for all the trouble you've
caused up to now...if you pull out of the Bushin
Festival.
So we should settle it in private, is what you mean.

Yeah, I'll make it worth your time. I can pay you
more than whatever your current boss is payin'.

Bookie holds up a few fingers. I don't know how much
money it is, but it looks like a lot.
Pay me, huh...

(It's tempting. I needed money, and lots of it, to
become a shadowbroker.)
(But now, I have Gamma and her deep pockets.)

...I don't trust you. If you pay 100 times that up
front, I'll consider it.
...Huh? A hun...? Don't play games with me.

Tch, are you makin' fun of me? You'd better watch
yourself!

You're gonna wish you took me up on that offer!
Mister, get over here!
(Mister...?)

Bookie glances over at an alleyway and on cue a huge
man, clutching an equally enormous axe, appears.
Your bodyguard, I take it?

Mister is a resident of the underworld, you're outta
luck! If you've got any last regrets, regret that you
were a greedy bastard!
It's...over!

The man moves to attack. A normal person would have
been crushed, but Mundane dodges with ease.
Wha...?
That it?

The moment that Mundane unsheathes his sword,
his opponent is cleaved in two.
It was instantaneous.
Huh...?

The man's huge frame lies still. Bookie stares on,
his jaw slack with shock.
Huh...? What...?
You're up next.
Y-You took him out...with a single hit...?

Mundane slowly approaches as he sheathes his sword,
glaring down at him before raising his fist.

Don't mess with the odds. I don't feel like standing
out just yet.
W-Wait—
Aaaaghh!!!
Mundane strikes Bookie with his fist.
Got it?
Urgh!!
I can't hear you.
G-G-Got it...!!!

Mundane continues to beat Bookie until he is too
weak to respond.
